intro: Lucaea junghuhnii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, humid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of alpine flora.
